Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha, ha!!!!! Who in God's name created that site. It reads like a child wrote it. Ninja just flip out and kill people? Ha, ha, ha!!!! Somebody put the author out of his misery, please!

Dean Wayland <dean@...> wrote:Hi Maikeru,

>    You know what I realized afte rlooking at Stephen Hayes dojo site. 
>    His 
>    buisness is shady at best. 
>
>    To go to one of his seminars it costs $300. And supposing I was 
>    dumb 
>    enough to want to teach his stuff at a dojo I would have to buy the
>    dvd on which class I want to teach, watch it, then send mor emoney 
>    to 
>    have a curriculum sent to me. 
>
>    http://www.skhquest.com/
>
>    Sorry to ressurect the whole Hayes thing, but god is there no 
>    decency.
>
>    Maikeru

Firstly, thanks for posting Hayes' URL, it was interesting to visit the
"horse's mouth(?)":-)

I think the answer to your last question is sadly no. However, Kitsuno
had previously put up the following link as an antidote for such woes,
so if you missed it, please go and enjoy:

http://www.realultimatepower.net/index4.htm

Now, seriously, as a re-enactor of Japanese history I am forever having
to explain, that in my opinion virtually the whole "ninja" thing is pure
baloney, although I do put it more politely than that normally. Does
anyone know of a web site that deals with this topic in a genuinely
scholarly fashion? So far, all I can find are the usual crop of ninja
wanabe dojo's, or those frothing at the mouth with their pre-pubescent
fantasies, as for the rest: - silence.

Cepo wrote that he had read mountains of books for his Phd, and not one
mention of the ninja, which to me is dam fine evidence. But what I need
to be able to point folks at is a reputable and scholarly discussion of
the subject, preferably short, putting the ninja in (or out of) their
historical context, citing the evidence one way or another. The trouble
is when I tried to write a short piece for my website, I realised, that
I'm massively unqualified to do it any kind of credible justice. So,
help!

I suspect that there is nothing out there as this whole subject has a
pariah quality about it, meaning that to date any scholar worth their
salt, treats it like a hot potato and leaves the topic well alone! Oh
well...

Yours

Dean
Definitely not a secret mystical ninja master from England, unless you
know otherwise:-)
